wikipedia_page.main: Naana Agyei-Ampadu is a British actress of Ghanaian descent.Born in Accra, Agyei-Ampadu moved to the UK as a child. She studied law at the University of Sussex, before embarking on a career in acting. She graduated from the Central School of Speech and Drama. Her stage credits include Caroline, Or Change, Avenue Q, Che Walker's The Frontline, Juliet in Measure for Measure at [Shakespeare's Globe],Been So Long and Feast (Young Vic). She was nominated for an Evening Standard Award for her performance in Been So Long.

response: In 2019, Berry-Hart was commissioned to curate the testimonies of women workers in the developing world to produce a short play for International Women's Day (#March4Women Rally) hosted by CARE International at Central Hall Westminster. The play was performed live by Helena Bonham Carter, Meera Syal, Nicola Thorp, Naana Agyei-Ampadu and Nina Sosanya, directed by Berry-Hart.
